long_desc.thetext:
When adding one more type to jclMin1.8.jar I observed a mysterious failure in JavaSearchBugs8Tests.testBug400899g38(): two of the expected exact matches turned into potential matches.
At a closer look, that new result is actually "better".
Here's what I see:
Object r = (@Marker java. @Marker util.@Marker Map<@Marker String, @Marker String>.@Marker Entry @Marker []) null;
This line contains 2 annotations in illegal positions (trying to annotate a package).
Q: Why does it succeed in HEAD? A: Because java.util.Map cannot be resolved (lacking from jclMin1.8.jar)
Oops?
Q: Why does a missing type help to get "better" search results? A: Because java.util.Map did *not* consist of two packages and a type, but only of unresolved tokens.
So, adding Map to the jar revealed that two occurrences are not kosher, hence they're flagged as potential matches. Makes sense?
Note, that the same also applies to java.util.List one line above (just I didn't add that to jclMin1.8.jar, so nothing changed here).

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #0) > When adding one more type to jclMin1.8.jar I observed a mysterious failure
Thanks Stephan for the bug and the detailed description. Fixed via commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=680617d4458e4e0aaf6f22e11f36dafc1f2501ee

(In reply to Manoj Palat from comment #1) > (In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #0) > > When adding one more type to jclMin1.8.jar I observed a mysterious failure > > Thanks Stephan for the bug and the detailed description. Fixed via commit: > http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/ > ?id=680617d4458e4e0aaf6f22e11f36dafc1f2501ee
shouldn't we actually add j.u.Map to jclMin1.8.jar if we reference it in our tests?

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #2) > shouldn't we actually add j.u.Map to jclMin1.8.jar if we reference it in our > tests?
Should this be addressed as part of this bug before closing or can it be taken up independently?

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #3) > (In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #2) > > shouldn't we actually add j.u.Map to jclMin1.8.jar if we reference it in our > > tests? > > Should this be addressed as part of this bug before closing or can it be > taken up independently?
ok. would reopen to add j.u.Map to jclMin1.8 jar
forgot to mention: please also consider j.u.List (also referenced from the same test) - or avoid it in tests, I think j.u.Collection is already there and can be used instead.

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #5) > forgot to mention: please also consider j.u.List (also referenced from the > same test) - or avoid it in tests, I think j.u.Collection is already there > and can be used instead.
Stephan: Yes; will include j.u.List and make this bug a more generic one as there are other tests also which has dependencies for j.u.List and map.
Added j.u.List and j.u.Map via commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=648e3dee736d15a9e9c8845dd7b4d320b09f57b7
Verified for Mars 4.5M2 using I20140915-2000 build.
